snax.name: Aggroll
snax.bio: The box protects it's body. Perhaps it can be grappled away.

snax.name: Baby Cakelegs
snax.bio: Recently cut from the cake. They seem to be seeking out their master.

snax.name: Banopper
snax.bio: Jumps from tree to tree. The Trip Shot should be useful here.

snax.name: Red Banopper
snax.bio: Jumps from tree to tree. The Trip Shot should be useful here.

snax.name: Big Bopsicle
snax.bio: Freezes anything that touches it. There must be a way to melt its icy armor.

snax.name: Bombino
snax.bio: When threatened, this Bugsnax becomes a explosive bomb!

snax.name: Bopsicle
snax.bio: The result of snapping a larger Snak in half. It is much more timid now.

snax.name: Bunger
snax.bio: This Bugsnak knocks away traps. It also tackles anything covered in ketchup.

snax.name: BBQ Bunger
snax.bio: This Bugsnak is more aggressive than its forest cousin

snax.name: Bunger Royale
snax.bio: It's a Bunger....but big!

snax.name: Buffalocust
snax.bio: This spicy menace divebombs into it's favorite sauce.

snax.name: Cappucceetle
snax.bio: The fastest Snak alive. When startled, it will flee to an entirely different region of Snaktooth Island

snax.name: Cellystix
snax.bio: So big that it unknowingly carries smaller Bugsnax on its back.

snax.name: Charmallow
snax.bio: This Snak is literally on fire. Some water or ice could put it out.

snax.name: Cheddaboardle Rex
snax.bio: The king of the jungle rolls Cheddorbs as an attack. Its lid protects its cheesy back.

snax.name: Cheddorb
snax.bio: If it gets rolling it bowls through anything in its path!

snax.name: Cheepoof
snax.bio: These things never land. If only there was a way to catch them in mid-air
snax.location: Sizzlin' Sands, Scorched Gorge, Frosted Peak

snax.name: White Cheepoof
snax.bio: A rare Cheepoof that exclusively comes out at night.

snax.name: Flamin' Cheepoof
snax.bio: Much like the Cheepoofs of the desert expect that they are constantly on fire, and live in a active volcano

snax.name: Cheery
snax.bio: Bounces around erratically but is otherwise helpless

snax.name: Cheezer
snax.bio: Zips around the dunes at extreme speed. Too bad the Trip Shot doesn't stick to sand.

snax.name: Chillynilly
snax.bio: Flying AND freezing cold. Thawing it might bring it down.

snax.name: Chippie
snax.bio: Climbs as quick as lightening. Could be tripped right off of the wall.

snax.name: Chocolant
snax.bio: Grows when exposed to open air. It likes to play keep away with its fellow Chocolants.

snax.name: Cinnasnail
snax.bio: Very slow, very sticky. It likes to stay far out of reach.

snax.name: Clawbsteroni
snax.bio: Strong enough to lift other Bugsnax, as well as its beloved trampoline.

snax.name: Cobhopper
snax.bio: Hops from tree to tree. Won't stop until it's tripped out of the air.

snax.name: Greater Cocomite
snax.bio: Works with its Lesser to tackle any threats.

snax.name: Lesser Cocomite
snax.bio: Works with its Greater to tackle any threats.

snax.name: Green Crapple
snax.bio: Prefers to stay underwater, but will surface to pick up things that catch its eye.

snax.name: Crapple
snax.bio: This curious Snak likes to dig things out of the sand and bring them to its lair.

snax.name: Daddy Cakelegs
snax.bio: This behemoth doesn't like having its candles lit. A flaming Trip Shot might do the trick....

snax.name: Deviled Eggler
snax.bio: Egglers with wings and aggressive tendencies.

snax.name: Eggler
snax.bio: Without its shell, this egg makes for an easy meal.

snax.name: Flapjackarak
snax.bio: Stirs up dust devils, flinging anything in its path high into the air.

snax.name: Flutterjam
snax.bio: This elusive flyer is looking for its favorite sauce. It wants to be coated in it.

snax.name: Fryder
snax.bio: Climbs onto high walls out of reach, but will come down if it smells ketchup

snax.name: Sweet Fryder
snax.bio: Similar to Fryders, but sweeter.

snax.name: Green Grapeskeeto
snax.bio: This one plumps up and slows down if it eats another Bugsnax.

snax.name: Grapeskeeto
snax.bio: Another Snak-eating pest. Though this one seems more solitary.

snax.name: Hunnabee
snax.bio: These Snak will stick to just about anything, including traps.

snax.name: Incherrito
snax.bio: As long as it's under the sand, it can't be caught. But it can't dig through solid rock....

snax.name: Inchwrap
snax.bio: As long as it's under the sand, it can't be caught. But it can't dig through solid objects....

snax.name: Instabug
snax.bio: This unusual Shiskabug loves the spotlight.

snax.name: Kweeble
snax.bio: It follows things it likes and nudges them with its spoon.

snax.name: Golden Kweeble
snax.bio: Exactly like a Kweeble but with distinctly golden sheen.

snax.name: Kwookie
snax.bio: So fast that it evades capture. There must be a way to trip it up.

snax.name: Black Lollive
snax.bio: Uses its pimento tongue to snatch up anything cheezy.

snax.name: Lollive
snax.bio: Latches onto snak and traps with its upsettingly long tongue.

snax.name: Mama Mewon
snax.bio: This massive Snak protects its offspring at all costs. Try to get the drop on it.

snax.name: Megamaki
snax.bio: The head of the beast. It can't be caught until it's run out of followers.

snax.name: Millimochi
snax.bio: It travels in a line with its friends, leaping at and freezing anything that crosses its path.

snax.name: Minimaki
snax.bio: They follow behind the head in perfect formation. And panic without its leadership.

snax.name: Mothza Supreme
snax.bio: Looks like it could use a good slicing.

snax.name: Noodler
snax.bio: Bathes in pools of lava. It can't be put out while in such a hot climate.

snax.name: Paletoss
snax.bio: Half the Snak it used to be, though it hasn't lost its cold fury.

snax.name: Paletoss Grande
snax.bio: Freezes anything it charges at. This might be useful against all these spicy Bugsnax...

snax.name: Pielobite
snax.bio: Its protective cover deflects Shrink Spice! The Snakgrappler would help remove it.

snax.name: Peelbug
snax.bio: It hides inside the crevices of the Scorched Gorge.

snax.name: Orange Peelbug
snax.bio: It rolls up and hides inside holes or logs. They'll have to be pushed out somewhere.

snax.name: Ruby Peelbug
snax.bio: It hides inside of narrow tunnels near the Flavor Falls.

snax.name: Yellow Peelbug
snax.bio: It hides inside the winding tunnels beneath the Sugarpine Woods.

snax.name: Pineantula
snax.bio: It burrows into the sand to hide. Perhaps another Bugsnak could dig it out...

snax.name: Pinkle
snax.bio: The jar protects it from capture. Perhaps it can be grappled away.

snax.name: Poptick
snax.bio: They are too small to catch in a trap, but maybe some heat will puff them up.

snax.name: Caramel Poptick
snax.bio: Pre-puffed and bouncing uncontrollably. May take more luck than skill to catch.

snax.name: Preying Picantis
snax.bio: Large, aggressive, and destructive. Best to be avoided.

snax.name: Black Razzby
snax.bio: A unique Razzby. It will need help escaping the underground.

snax.name: Razzby
snax.bio: The Strabby of the beach.

snax.name: Rootle
snax.bio: Burrows into the soil when scared.

snax.name: White Rootle
snax.bio: Seldom seen at the same time as regular Rootles.

snax.name: Sandopede
snax.bio: Speeds along crashing into things. It won't slow down unitl it's broken up.

snax.name: Sub Sandopede
snax.bio: These are actually seperate Bugsnax that work together as a Sandopede.

snax.name: Scoopy
snax.bio: It drills beneath the snow, waiting to unleash frosty vengeance on its foes!

snax.name: Scoopy Banoopy
snax.bio: It catches prey in its forelegs and freezes them! Get away fast!

snax.name: Scorpenyo
snax.bio: This Snak lobs fiery peppers at anything that catches its attention.

snax.name: Scorpepper
snax.bio: Lurks invisibly on desert rocks, and roasts anything that gets too close.

snax.name: Sherbie
snax.bio: It drills beneath the snow, waiting to unleash frosty vengeance on its foes!

snax.name: Shishkabug
snax.bio: Once this pest hides, it won't come out of hiding until it's forced out.

snax.name: Snakpod
snax.bio: Hidden around Garden Grove. Once found, it's easy to pick up.

snax.name: Fruity Snakpod
snax.bio: Hidden around the Boiling Bay. Is this made of other dried Snak?

snax.name: Grumpy Snakpod
snax.bio: Hidden around the Simmering Springs. Looks like tiny Grumpuses.

snax.name: Meaty Snakpod
snax.bio: Hidden around the Sizzlin' Sands. Thrives in the arid climate.

snax.name: Melty Snakpod
snax.bio: Hidden around the Frosted Peak. The temperature keeps it from melting.

snax.name: Nutty Snakpod
snax.bio: Hidden around the Sugarpine Woods. A great Snak while hiking.

snax.name: Puffy Snakpod
snax.bio: Hidden around the Scorched Gorge. Just a little bit spicy.

snax.name: Twisty Snakpod
snax.bio: Hidden around the Flavor Falls. Not quite as healthy as you'd think.

snax.name: Snaquiri
snax.bio: Leaps in and out of the ocean. Needs to be caught mid-leap.

snax.name: Dr. Sodie
snax.bio: This carbonated bug sprays a watery jet at any sauce it sees.

snax.name: Sodie D
snax.bio: This liquidy bug lives in the oasis and won't tolerate the presence of sauce.

snax.name: La Sodieux
snax.bio: This bug skims along the ocean floor, and sprays water at nearby sauce.

snax.name: Mt. Sodie
snax.bio: This bug washes away sauce, and somehow stays unfrozen in the cold.

snax.name: Spaghider
snax.bio: Pulls its prey into the canopy with its noodles!

snax.name: Sprinklepede
snax.bio: It likes to climb high structures. Maybe some sauce could get it to move.

snax.name: Spuddy
snax.bio: It protects its territory by charging at intruders with its powerful jaws.

snax.name: Loaded Spuddy
snax.bio: It smashes anything that makes it angry. Which is everything.

snax.name: Strabby
snax.bio: A very simple Snak. Watch its walking pattern.

snax.name: White Strabby
snax.bio: Exactly like the Strabby in every way other than its pale color.

snax.name: Stewdler
snax.bio: The boiling Snak is a source of warmth in the bitter cold.

snax.name: Sweetiefly
snax.bio: It zips around fast enough to evade traps, but eventually settles down to rest.

snax.name: Crystal Sweetiefly
snax.bio: It zips around fast enough to evade traps, but eventually settles down to rest.

snax.name: Lovely Sweetiefly
snax.bio: It zips around fast enough to evade traps, but eventually settles down to rest.

snax.name: Rainbow Sweetiefly
snax.bio: It zips around fast enough to evade traps, but eventually settles down to rest.

snax.name: Tacroach
snax.bio: A very timid Snak. It seems easy to catch.

snax.name: Baja Tacroach
snax.bio: Tacoroaches that took on the flavor of the ocean. Still very timid.

snax.name: Tikkada Masala
snax.bio: Patrols the area around its nest, keeping a lookout for Eggler shells.

snax.name: Tropicabug
snax.bio: Stays hidden forever once scared. Or at least until an aggressive Snak attacks.

snax.name: Waffstackarak
snax.bio: Summoned by a dinnerbell. It uses its twirling sausage legs to create localized water sprouts.

snax.name: Wee Mewon
snax.bio: Offspring of the Mama Mewon. They're a nuisance but pretty easy to catch...

snax.name: Weenyworm
snax.bio: A lazy little worm, it's only motivated by ketchup.

snax.name: Shy Weenyworm
snax.bio: A lazy little worm, it's only motivated by its hatred of ketchup.
